description: Karina passes critical data to underground activists, enabling them to decode Halden's fail-safe protocols.
The underground network activates Halden's protocols, triggering the gradual dismantling of the BCI's most restrictive measures.
The underground network publishes documents online exposing the intrusive nature of the BCI, garnering public support for reform.
Public demonstrations grow as citizens demand changes to the BCI system and call for a transition to democratic governance.
A faction within the Directorate attempts to regain control, labeling activists as threats to national security and urging for protective countermeasures.
National debate reaches a peak as citizens, officials, and experts discuss the future of governance in Stenograd, amid calls for transparency and democracy.
